title: Earphones not recognised Pixel 3
content:
Hi, 
I was hoping someone here knows of a solution. I've tried a few things now and seen a lot of this issue across the internet and am still no further. I have tried contacting support but they don't seem to know the answer. 

A couple of days  ago randomly my wired earphones (the original google ones) and the adapter with regular earphones, are not recognised by the phone. Sometimes i can get a 'Charging connected device via USB notification' but that's about it. Sound just continues to play out loud. However, am having no problems with charging.  The device is almost 2 years old but there doesn't seem to be a particular reason for this starting. 

So far I have tried, gently cleaning the port, rebooting the phone, a factory reset, deleting recent apps/booting in safe mode, disabling assistant through headphones and checking that the  USB - audio routing is off. 

Has anyone found another fix, really dont want to be stuck without music ?!!
